p: A machine learning method (i.e., RF) was used to model the effects of VPD on NDVI. RF combines tree predictors such that each tree depends on the values of a random vector that is sampled independently, with the same distribution for all trees in the forest. We constructed RF models for simulating annual growing season mean NDVI at each pixel driven by air temperature, precipitation, radiation, wind speed, atmospheric [CO 2] concentration, and VPD. The training data were the GIMMS3g NDVI dataset from 1982 to 2015. The R package “randomForest” used in the study was modified by A. Liaw and M. Wiener from the original Fortran by L. Breiman and A. Cutler ( https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/randomForest/).
